subject: Critical Thinking
title: Framing: How the Same Story Becomes Two Truths
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Framing: How the Same Story Becomes Two Truths.

hook.text: 'Unemployment falls to 5%' and '1 in 20 workers can't find a job.' Same fact. Completely different emotional impact.

buildup.text: Framing: selecting which aspects of reality to emphasize, which to minimize, and which to omit entirely.

discovery.text: George Lakoff: political frames are so powerful that facts presented outside the frame are literally not processed.

twist.text: 'Tax relief' frames taxes as a burden. 'Revenue investment' frames them as a tool.

climax.text: When consuming media, ask: 'What frame is being used? What would this look like in a different frame?'

punchline.text: You can't escape frames. But you can switch between them.

quiz.question: Why is media framing so powerful?
options: It determines which aspects of reality are emphasized, minimized, or omitted
